Artifact¶

class vulcanforge.artifact.model.ArtifactApiMixin[source]¶

Bases: object

Objects that behave as artifacts within the forge need to implement this

get_discussion_thread(data=None, generate_if_missing=True)[source]¶

Return the discussion thread for this artifact (possibly made more specific by the message_data)

@rtype: vulcanforge.discussion.model.Thread

has_relations()[source]¶

returns boolean

index_id()[source]¶

Globally unique artifact identifier.

Used for SOLR ID, shortlinks, and maybe elsewhere

link_text()[source]¶

The link text that will be used when a shortlink to this artifact is expanded into an <a></a> tag.

By default this method returns shorthand_id(). Subclasses should override this method to provide more descriptive link text.

link_text_short()[source]¶

Shortened version of the link text. Defaults to same as link_text.

Used for ReferenceBin @return: str

parent_security_context()[source]¶

ACL processing should continue at the AppConfig object. This lets AppConfigs provide a ‘default’ ACL for all artifacts in the tool.

primary()[source]¶

If an artifact is a “secondary” artifact (discussion of a ticket, for instance), return the artifact that is the “primary”.

raw_url()[source]¶

Url at which to download the resource.

@return: str

ref_category()[source]¶

Category for grouping types of relations

@return: str

relations()[source]¶

generator for related artifacts with link context

(extra field in ArtifactReference.references)

shorthand_id()[source]¶

How to refer to this artifact within the app instance context.

For a wiki page, it might be the title. For a ticket, it might be the ticket number. For a discussion, it might be the message ID. Generally this should have a strong correlation to the URL.

url()[source]¶

Subclasses should implement this, providing the URL to the artifact

class vulcanforge.artifact.model.Artifact[source]¶

Bases: vulcanforge.common.model.base.BaseMappedClass, vulcanforge.artifact.model.ArtifactApiMixin

The base class for anything you want to keep track of.

It will automatically be added to solr (see index() method). It also gains a discussion thread and can have files attached to it.

Variables:
  • tool_version – default’s to the app’s version
  • acl – dict of permission name => [roles]
  • labels – list of plain old strings
get_link_content()[source]¶

Text content that contains the artifacts shortlinks

Used for parsing references

get_read_roles()[source]¶

It can only be more restrictive than the project read roles @return:

index(text_objects=None, use_posts=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

TODO: update docstring

Subclasses should override this, providing a dictionary of solr_field => value. These fields & values will be stored by solr. Subclasses should call the this and extend it with more fields. All these fields will be included in the ‘text’ field (done by search.solarize())

The _s and _t suffixes, for example, follow solr dynamic field naming pattern. You probably want to override at least title_s and text to have meaningful search results and email senders.

index_parent()[source]¶

For artifacts whose parent indexes should be updated when they are updated (e.g. Posts) @return: artifact | None
